data.description: Company Information PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of high-quality light-, medium- and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF nameplates. PACCAR designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines and also provides customized financial services, information technology, and truck parts related to its principal business. We’re investing in sustainability for the long haul. We are a purpose-led, values-driven company that believes the work we do today makes a difference tomorrow. Whether you are starting out your career or continuing to build upon one, PACCAR provides opportunities for both! Join a community of professionals that is helping build the best in industry products and services that keep our communities running! Requisition Summary PACCAR is searching for talented individuals to join our Worldwide Credit Data Analytics team for 2025! The selected individual will work with our team in Bellevue, WA. We are pleased you are seeking an internship with PACCAR and wish you the best of luck! Internships include unique learning opportunities such as: Learn first-hand from the industry’s top professionals Work directly with Senior Managers and Directors Develop mentoring relationships with experienced professionals Gain valuable hands-on experience The Intern will be a part of the Worldwide Credit Data Analytics group, supporting our global credit organization. The intern will gain exposure and hands-on experience in data analytics supporting risk assessment and risk management across its global credit portfolios, while interpreting and applying credit policies. Internships are scheduled to begin in early to mid-May/June 2026.Job Functions / Responsibilities Participate in project-based work with our Worldwide Credit Data Analytics team Complete assigned projects with Credit Director and manager support Assist with analysis and reporting to include: Support data scientists in developing, training, and deploying AI/ML models Reporting trends in customer/dealer transactions and portfolio quality Assisting with month-end and ad hoc reporting on credit transactions and portfolio quality Developing centralized management of global credit risk models Integrating new data sources for use by analysts Creating KPI reporting dashboards using Tableau Migrating data and analytic capabilities into AWS Effectively communicate analytic results that demonstrate business impacts Directly impact a project that will lead to process and operational improvement! Skills / Competencies Proficient in Microsoft Office; capable of advanced functions in MS Excel. Exposure and basic-level skills with technologies used by the team: SQL Server and Relational Databases Cloud-based data environments Analytic programming languages (e.g. R, Python, etc) Excellent verbal and written communication skills Resourceful and a self-starter Strong professionalism Analytical and critical thinking Education Bachelor's Degree in Progress in junior or senior standing preferred Currently pursuing a degree in Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Business, Finance, or other related fields Intern Benefits As a U.S. PACCAR intern, you have a full range of benefit options including: Competitive salary and 401k with up to a 5% company match Medical, dental, and vision plans for you and your family Flexible spending accounts (FSA) and health savings account (HSA) EAP services: including wellness plans, estate planning, financial counseling, and more Global Fortune 500 company with a wide array of growth, training, and development opportunities Work alongside experienced goal-oriented colleagues recognized as experts in their field Additional Job Board Information At PACCAR, we value talent and promote growth and development. We carefully consider numerous compensation factors, including your education, training, or experience. The salary range for internship positions is $25 an hour for undergraduate students and $30 an hour for graduate students. Additionally, this role is eligible for a range of benefit options listed above. If you would like more information about what makes PACCAR an excellent place to work, please visit the PACCAR Career Site. PACCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability.
